paper_abstract: This article proposes a unified multivariate statistical monitoring framework that incorporates recent work on maximum likelihood PCA (MLPCA) into conventional PCA-based monitoring. The proposed approach allows the simultaneous and consistent estimation of the PCA model plane, its dimension and the error covariance matrix. This paper also invokes recent work on monitoring non-Gaussian processes to extract unknown Gaussian as well as non-Gaussian source signals from recorded process data. By contrasting the unified framework with PCA-based process monitoring using a simulation example and recorded data from two industrial processes, the proposed approach produced more accurate and/or sensitive monitoring models. paper_title: A unified statistical framework for monitoring multivariate systems with unknown source and error signals
